title: Citi Guatemala Launches Sixth Edition of Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards
summary: Guatemala City, Guatemala – For a sixth consecutive year and together with support from the Network of Microfinance Institutions of Guatemala (REDIMIF), Citi announced the launch of Citi Micro-entrepreneurship Award Guatemala 2011.
tag-1: Citi Guatemala Launches Sixth Edition of Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards
tag-2: Guatemala City, Guatemala – For a sixth consecutive year and together with support from the Network of Microfinance Institutions of Guatemala (REDIMIF), Citi announced the launch of Citi Micro-entrepreneurship Award Guatemala 2011.
tag-3: The Citi Micro-entrepreneurship Award seeks to distinguish the achievement of micro-entrepreneurs across Guatemala and to promote microfinance across the country as a development tool to reduce poverty.
tag-4: "Microcredit and microenterprise have a positive impact in communities worldwide. We invite you to participate in this award so we can recognize Guatemalan entrepreneurs seeking to grow and continue their support to country's development," said Juan Miro, Citi Country Officer Guatemala. "Initiatives like this demonstrate our commitment to responsible finance, as well as with the development of communities we live and work."
tag-5: More than 100 micro-entrepreneurs from around the country have participated in the previous five editions, and more than US$80,000 has been granted in awards. Seventy-nine of the major microfinance institutions in Guatemala have supported this initiative.
tag-6: Ovidio Armando, 2010 Winner of Winners, said: "Thanks to this initiative, we have continued teaching the art of playing marimba to groups of young adults. I invite microentrepreneurs to participate in the Citi Micro-entrepreneurship Awards because with these opportunities they can continue to expand their business while improving their families' lifestyle."
tag-7: In the past, monetary awards have been used by winners to expand their business, invest in resources for their businesses and increase business sales. This year's program counts with the participation of 150 entrepreneurs and nearly a dozen financial institutions.

tag-9: Participants may apply within five categories:
tag-10: The following monetary prizes will be awarded for each category: first prize – US$1,400; second prize – US$1,100; and third prize – US$850, tax free.
tag-11: From the top five of each category, a 'Winner of Winners' will be selected and receive a prize of US$3,250 tax free, in recognition of their innovation and entrepreneurial drive.
tag-12: Additionally, for a second consecutive year, the "Women4Citi" recognition will be granted to a micro-entrepreneurial woman who, in recent years, had a significant social impact in her local community. For the first time, this recipient will also receive the "Sustainable Development" distinction for good management of natural resources.
tag-13: Applications will be reviewed by microcredit experts and winners will be selected by a jury of microcredit experts, political leaders and journalists. Finalists and winners for each category will be announced in November during an awards ceremony in Guatemala City. Additionally, this year there will be a micro-entrepreneur training program for finalists seeking to enhance their competitiveness and development.
tag-14: For additional information about the program, or to get involved, please contact: REDIMIF, Daniel Ruiz at 2332-1920, redimif@redimif.org – www.redimif.org
tag-15: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-16: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-17: REDIMIF Microfinance Institutions Network of Guatemala, REDIMIF, is a chamber of associations and foundations working in the microfinance sector, aiming to represent its members as legal entities, coordinating and channeling initiatives and resources of partnering institutions, to foster mutual benefit projects. REDIMIF has national coverage through its 17 partnering institutions that, through its 118 offices and branches, serve more than 158,000 micro and small businesses. 53.65 percent of loan portfolio has been granted in rural areas, and 66 percent of loans have been granted to women. www.redimif.org & www.redimif.org
